metadata.title: CVE-2016-0605 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.6.26 and earlier allows remoteauthenticated users to affect availability via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0605` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
